title: A globally driven superconducting quantum computing architecture
authors:
Roberto Menta, Francesco Cioni, Riccardo Aiudi, Marco Polini, Vittorio
  Giovannetti
abstract:
We propose a platform for implementing a universal, globally driven quantum
computer based on a 2D ladder hosting three different species of
superconducting qubits. In stark contrast with the existing literature, our
scheme exploits the always-on longitudinal ZZ coupling. The latter, combined
with specific driving frequencies, enables the reach of a blockade regime,
which plays a pivotal role in the computing scheme.
